pathAssistantSteps.info: Candidate has appealed their examination outcome and appeal process is underway.
The recommended exam outcome has gone to the Chair of the Board of Graduate Research for review.

An examination outcome is usually closed once the candidate has been notified of the outcome and the appeal period has passed. If a candidate appeals the examination outcome, the record will remain open until the appeal is concluded.
The GRS has sent a letter of decision and copies of the examiners’ reports (or a copy of the approved revision plan for deferred outcomes) to the candidate and supervisors.
The GRS Operations Manager reviews the examination recommendations before sending the form to the School Director of Graduate Research for review.
Details of the examiner recommendations to be entered by the GRS.
The GRS reviews the School Director of Graduate Research’s recommendations to determine the next steps.
The School Director of Graduate Research has convened an Advisory Panel to make a recommendation on the examination outcome of the grade of a Masters thesis.
The Advisory Panel has recommended the thesis be classified as deferred and is determining a plan for the revision of the thesis.

The School Director of Graduate Research reviews the examiners reports and makes a recommendation on examination outcome. If PhD also reviews for recommendation on Nancy Millis Medal. If Masters by Research, also provides a recommended mark.
